dict.string:
To begin, define a function that accepts a `ToneResponse` and returns an `Emotion`.
`func getPrimaryEmotion(from toneResponse: ToneResponse) -> Emotion`
Be sure to check the `error` property of the `ToneResponse`. If Watson returns an error, your function should return `.unknown`.

One way to figure out which emotion is dominant is to put all of the emotion values in an array and sort it. To keep track of which `Emotion` corresponds to which value, put them in a Dictionary like so:
``` let dict: [Emotion: Double] = [ .anger: toneResponse.emotion.anger, .fear: toneResponse.emotion.fear, ... ] ```

``` let dict: [Emotion: Double] = [ .anger: toneResponse.emotion.anger, .fear: toneResponse.emotion.fear, .joy: toneResponse.emotion.joy, .sadness: toneResponse.emotion.sadness ]
let sortedEmotions = Array(dict).sorted {$0.1 > $1.1} ```
